alert.note: Alert for Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 8:22PM EDT until July 07 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM EDT, emergency management reported flash flooding in New Hope at 722 pm, resulting in a motorist needed to be rescued due to high water. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldsboro, Walnut Creek, Elroy, Brogden and Mar-Mac. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Claridge Nursery Rd near Hwy 70 intersection and Stoney Creek between East Beech St & Elm St. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
